intro: Acriopsis inopinata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cowplant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Acriopsis inopinata is typically found in rocky soils and dry habitats, thriving in arid environments.
